content:
TITLE: Cloning and Setting Up Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for cloning the forked repository locally and navigating to the project directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/<your_github_username>/<fork_name>.git
cd <fork_name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checklist for Pull Request Author in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a checklist for the pull request author to ensure all necessary steps have been completed before submitting the PR. It includes items for testing, adding tests, updating documentation, and handling environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## Checklist for PR author
- [ ] I have tested these changes locally.
- [ ] I added tests to cover any new functionality, following this [guide](./CONTRIBUTING.md#writing--running-tests)
- [ ] Whenever I fix a bug, I include a regression test to ensure that the bug does not reappear silently.
- [ ] If I have added, changed, renamed, or removed an environment variable
    - I updated the list of environment variables in the [documentation](ENVS.md) 
    - I made the necessary changes to the validator script according to the [guide](./CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-new-env-variable)
    - I added "ENVs" label to this pull request
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all project dependencies using Yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Development Server with Custom Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server with custom environment configuration for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Blockscout Frontend Docker Container with Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Blockscout frontend Docker container with port mapping and environment variables configured from a file. This is the recommended way to deploy the application with custom configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -p 3000:3000 --env-file <path-to-your-env-file> ghcr.io/blockscout/frontend:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Development Server with Predefined Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server using one of the predefined configuration presets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev:preset <config_preset_name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running BlockScout Frontend Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the BlockScout frontend Docker container with environment variables and port mapping. Maps container port 3000 to host port 3000 and specifies an environment file for configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CUSTOM_BUILD.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run -p 3000:3000 --env-file <path-to-your-env-file> <your-image-tag>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Marketplace App Configuration Schema
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema defining required and optional properties for configuring marketplace applications in Blockscout. Includes properties for app identification, display, and functionality settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface MarketplaceApp {
  id: string;
  external?: boolean;
  title: string;
  logo: string;
  shortDescription: string;
  categories: string[];
  author: string;
  url: string;
  description: string;
  site?: string;
  twitter?: string;
  telegram?: string;
  github?: string;
  internalWallet?: boolean;
  priority?: number;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Local Development Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for local development setup including installation, development server, and build process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/toolkit/package/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn
yarn dev
yarn build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Docker Container with User Configuration (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the application from a previously built local Docker image using the user's configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn start:docker:local
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Address Format in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies the displayed address format(s). It allows for either base16 or bech32 standards, with the option to enable a toggle in the UI. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_ADDRESS_FORMAT environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_ADDRESS_FORMAT": "['bech32', 'base16']"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linting Project Files with ESLint (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command lints the project files using ESLint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn lint:eslint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Jest Unit Tests (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command runs all Jest unit tests for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn test:jest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SUAVE Chain Support in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for blockchains implementing SUAVE architecture. Enables additional fields on the transaction page and a separate view for Kettle transactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_44

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_SUAVE_CHAIN | `boolean` | Set to true for blockchains with [SUAVE architecture](https://writings.flashbots.net/mevm-suave-centauri-and-beyond) | Required | - | `true` | v1.14.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Parent Chain Properties in Rollup Chain Setup
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLUP_PARENT_CHAIN variable which defines configuration parameters for the parent chain in a rollup setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{'baseUrl':'https://explorer.duckchain.io'}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Featured Networks Configuration in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Example of the NEXT_PUBLIC_FEATURED_NETWORKS configuration, showing how to define network entries with title, URL, group, and icon properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[{'title':'Astar(EVM)','url':'https://astar.blockscout.com/','group':'Mainnets','icon':'https://example.com/astar.svg'}]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Celo Chain Support in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for Celo-based blockchains. Includes settings for Celo mainnet's transition to an L2 chain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_45

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_CELO_ENABLED | `boolean` | Indicates that it is a Celo-based chain. | - | - | `true` | v1.37.0+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_CELO_L2_UPGRADE_BLOCK | `number` | Indicates the block number when the Celo-type chain transitioned to L2. This is used to display links to the Epoch block page from a regular block page. | - | - | `26369280` | v1.37.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Blockchain Interaction Features in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the environment variables required for enabling blockchain interaction features like writing to contracts in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_WALLET_CONNECT_PROJECT_ID | `string` | Project id for [WalletConnect](https://cloud.walletconnect.com/) integration | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_RPC_URL | `string` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | Required | - | `https://core.poa.network` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_NAME | `string` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | Required | - | `Gnosis Chain` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_ID | `number` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | Required | -  | `99` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_CURRENCY_NAME | `string` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | Required | - | `Ether` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_CURRENCY_SYMBOL | `string` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | Required | - | `ETH` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_CURRENCY_DECIMALS | `string` | See in [Blockchain parameters](ENVS.md#blockchain-parameters) section | - | `18` | `6` | v1.0.x+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extended Theme Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example of extending the Blockscout theme with custom overrides using createSystem.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/toolkit/package/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { createSystem } from '@chakra-ui/react';
import { themeConfig } from '@blockscout/ui-toolkit';

const customOverrides = {
  // Add your custom theme overrides here
  colors: {
    brand: {
      primary: '#your-color',
    },
  },
};

export default createSystem(themeConfig, customOverrides);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Address Profile API in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for integrating an external API to fetch user info for addresses or contracts. When set up, it displays a username as a public tag with a custom link in the address page header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_41

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_ADDRESS_USERNAME_TAG | `{api_url: string; tag_link_template: string; tag_icon: string; tag_bg_color: string; tag_text_color: string}` | Address profile API tag configuration properties. See [below](#user-profile-api-configuration-properties). | - | - | `uniswap` | v1.35.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring My Account Feature in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the environment variables required for enabling and configuring the My Account feature in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_ACCOUNT_SUPPORTED | `boolean` | Set to true if network has account feature | Required | - | `true` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_RE_CAPTCHA_APP_SITE_KEY | `boolean` | See [below](ENVS.md#google-recaptcha) | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AUTH0_CLIENT_ID | `string` | **DEPRECATED** Client id for [Auth0](https://auth0.com/) provider | - | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AUTH_URL | `string` | **DEPRECATED** Account auth base url; it is used for building login URL (`${ NEXT_PUBLIC_AUTH_URL }/auth/auth0`) and logout return URL (`${ NEXT_PUBLIC_AUTH_URL }/auth/logout`); if not provided the base app URL will be used instead | - | - | `https://blockscout.com` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_LOGOUT_URL | `string` | **DEPRECATED** Account logout url. Required if account is supported for the app instance. | - | - | `https://blockscoutcom.us.auth0.com/v2/logout` | v1.0.x+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bridged Token Configuration Schema
DESCRIPTION: Configuration schema for bridged tokens functionality, defining properties for chain identification and bridge types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface BridgedTokenChain {
  id: string;
  title: string;
  short_title: string;
  base_url: string;
}

interface TokenBridge {
  type: string;
  title: string;
  short_title: string;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Beacon Chain Support in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the environment variables for enabling and configuring Beacon Chain support in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_HAS_BEACON_CHAIN | `boolean` | Set to true for networks with the beacon chain | Required | - | `true` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_BEACON_CHAIN_CURRENCY_SYMBOL | `string` | Beacon network currency symbol | - | `NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_CURRENCY_SYMBOL` | `ETH` | v1.0.x+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Validators List in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable the Validators page, providing detailed information about validators of PoS chains.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_47

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_VALIDATORS_CHAIN_TYPE | `'stability' \| 'blackfort' \| 'zilliqa'` | Chain type | Required | - | `'stability'` | v1.25.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring OpenTelemetry in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling and setting up OpenTelemetry SDK for Node.js app in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| OTEL_SDK_ENABLED | `boolean` | Run-time flag to enable the feature | Required | `false` | `true` | v1.18.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Gas Tracker Feature in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the environment variables for enabling and configuring the Gas Tracker feature in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_GAS_TRACKER_ENABLED | `boolean` | Set to true to enable "Gas tracker" in the app | Required | `true` | `false` | v1.25.0+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_GAS_TRACKER_UNITS | Array<`usd` \| `gwei`> | Array of units for displaying gas prices on the Gas Tracker page, in the stats snippet on the Home page, and in the top bar. The first value in the array will take priority over the second one in all mentioned views. If only one value is provided, gas prices will be displayed only in that unit. | - | `[ 'usd', 'gwei' ]` | `[ 'gwei' ]` | v1.25.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring User Operations (ERC-4337) Support in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the environment variable for enabling support for user operations (ERC-4337) in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_HAS_USER_OPS | `boolean` | Set to true to show user operations related data and pages | - | - | `true` | v1.23.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Network Explorers in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies an array of network explorers to build links for transactions, blocks, and addresses in other chain explorers. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_EXPLORERS environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_EXPLORERS": "[{'title':'Anyblock','baseUrl':'https://explorer.anyblock.tools','paths':{'tx':'/ethereum/poa/core/tx'}}]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Playwright Component Tests in Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Playwright component tests in Docker environment and update snapshots for visual regression testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn test:pw:docker <path-to-file> --update-snapshots
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Rollbar Error Monitoring in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for integrating Rollbar error monitoring in the Blockscout frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_49

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLBAR_CLIENT_TOKEN | `string` | Client token for your Rollbar project | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.37.x+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Network Explorer Configuration in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration properties for the network explorer feature, including logo, title, base URL, and entity paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| logo | `string` | URL to explorer logo file. Should be at least 40x40. | - | - | `'https://foo.app/icon.png'` |
| title | `string` | Displayed name of the explorer | Required | - | `Anyblock` |
| baseUrl | `string` | Base url of the explorer | Required | - | `https://explorer.anyblock.tools` |
| paths | `Record<'tx' \| 'block' \| 'address' \| 'token', string>` | Map of explorer entities and their paths | Required | - | `{'tx':'/ethereum/poa/core/tx'}` |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Homepage Hero Banner Properties in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the hero banner on the Blockscout homepage, showing how to set background, text color, border, and button styles for both light and dark modes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{'_default':{'background':['deeppink'],'text_color':['white']}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default Color Theme in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets the preferred color theme of the app. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_COLOR_THEME_DEFAULT environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_COLOR_THEME_DEFAULT": "midnight"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Required Dependencies Configuration
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration showing the required peer dependencies and their minimum versions for the UI toolkit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/toolkit/package/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "dependencies": {
    "@blockscout/ui-toolkit": "latest",
    "@chakra-ui/react": ">=3.15.0",
    "@emotion/react": ">=11.14.0",
    "next": ">=15.2.3",
    "next-themes": ">=0.4.4",
    "react": ">=18.3.1",
    "react-dom": ">=18.3.1",
    "react-hook-form": ">=7.52.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@chakra-ui/cli": ">=3.15.0",
    "@types/node": "^20",
    "@types/react": "18.3.12",
    "@types/react-dom": "18.3.1",
    "typescript": "5.4.2"
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Contract Language Filters in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies the contract languages that will be displayed as options in the filter on the verified contract page. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_CONTRACT_LANGUAGE_FILTERS environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_CONTRACT_LANGUAGE_FILTERS": "['solidity','vyper','yul','scilla']"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Contract Audit Reports in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration enables or disables the Submit Audit form on the contract page. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_HAS_CONTRACT_AUDIT_REPORTS environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_HAS_CONTRACT_AUDIT_REPORTS": "true"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linting and Fixing Project Files with ESLint (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command lints the project files using ESLint and automatically fixes problems where possible.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn lint:eslint:fix
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Contract Code IDEs in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies an array of IDEs to build links for viewing contract source code. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_CONTRACT_CODE_IDES environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_CONTRACT_CODE_IDES": "[{'title':'Remix IDE','url':'https://remix.blockscout.com/?address={hash}&blockscout={domain}','icon_url':'https://example.com/icon.svg'}]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Helia Verified Fetch for NFTs in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration enables or disables the use of Helia verified fetch for retrieving content of NFT assets from IPFS network. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_HELIA_VERIFIED_FETCH_ENABLED environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_HELIA_VERIFIED_FETCH_ENABLED": "false"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Get Gas Button in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling a Get gas button in the top bar, linking to a gas refuel application in the marketplace or an external site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_54

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_GAS_REFUEL_PROVIDER_CONFIG | `{ name: string; url_template: string; dapp_id?: string; logo?: string }` | Get gas button config. See [below](#get-gas-button-configuration-properties) | - | - | `{ name: 'Need gas?', dapp_id: 'smol-refuel', url_template: 'https://smolrefuel.com/?outboundChain={chainId}', logo: 'https://example.com/icon.png' }` | v1.33.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring NFT Marketplaces in BlockScout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: This configuration specifies an array of NFT marketplaces to build links for NFT collections and instances. It uses the NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_NFT_MARKETPLACES environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"NEXT_PUBLIC_VIEWS_NFT_MARKETPLACES": "[{'name':'OpenSea','collection_url':'https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/{hash}','instance_url':'https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/{hash}/{id}','logo_url':'https://opensea.io/static/images/logos/opensea-logo.svg'}]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Save on Gas with GasHawk in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling a 'Save with GasHawk' button next to the 'Gas used' value on the address page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_56

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_SAVE_ON_GAS_ENABLED | `boolean` | Set to "true" to enable the feature | - | - | `true` | v1.35.0+ |
```

TITLE: Configuring Multichain Balance Button in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling a Multichain balance button on the address page, linking to a portfolio application in the marketplace or an external site.

```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_MULTICHAIN_BALANCE_PROVIDER_CONFIG | `[{ name: string; url_template: string; dapp_id?: string; logo: string }]` | Multichain portfolio application config See [below](#multichain-button-configuration-properties) | - | - | `[{ name: 'zerion', url_template: 'https://app.zerion.io/{address}/overview', logo: 'https://example.com/icon.svg'}]` | v1.31.0+ |
```

TITLE: Configuring Multichain Button Properties in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Detailed configuration properties for the Multichain balance button, including application name, URL template, and logo settings.

| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | `string` | Multichain portfolio application name | Required | - | `zerion` |
| url_template | `string` | Url template to the portfolio. Should be a template with `{address}` variable | Required | - | `https://app.zerion.io/{address}/overview` |
| dapp_id | `string` | Set for open a Blockscout dapp page with the portfolio instead of opening external app page | - | - | `zerion` |
| logo | `string` | Multichain portfolio application logo (.svg) url | - | - | `https://example.com/icon.svg` |
```

| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_CONTRACT_INFO_API_HOST | `string` | Contract Info API endpoint url | Required | - | `https://contracts-info.services.blockscout.com` | v1.1.0+ |

TITLE: Configuring Address Profile API Properties in Blockscout Frontend
DESCRIPTION: Detailed configuration properties for the Address Profile API, including API URL template, tag link template, icon URL, and color settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_42

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| api_url_template | `string` | User profile API URL. Should be a template with `{address}` variable | Required | - | `https://example-api.com/{address}` |
| tag_link_template | `string` | External link to the profile. Should be a template with `{username}` variable | - | - | `https://example.com/{address}` |
| tag_icon | `string` | Public tag icon (.svg) url | - | - | `https://example.com/icon.svg` |
| tag_bg_color | `string` | Public tag background color (escape "#" symbol if you use HEX color codes or use rgba-value instead) | - | - | `\#000000` |
| tag_text_color | `string` | Public tag text color (escape "#" symbol if you use HEX color codes or use rgba-value instead) | - | - | `\#FFFFFF` |
```

```

TITLE: Configuring Banner Ads in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the environment variables for configuring banner advertisements in the Blockscout frontend, including provider selection and placement configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AD_BANNER_PROVIDER | `slise` \| `adbutler` \| `coinzilla` \|  `hype` \| `getit` \| `none` | Ads provider  | - | `slise` | `coinzilla` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AD_BANNER_ADDITIONAL_PROVIDER | `adbutler` | Additional ads provider to mix with the main one | - | - | `adbutler` | v1.28.0+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AD_ADBUTLER_CONFIG_DESKTOP | `{ id: string; width: string; height: string }` | Placement config for desktop Adbutler banner | - | - | `{'id':'123456','width':'728','height':'90'}` | v1.3.0+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_AD_ADBUTLER_CONFIG_MOBILE | `{ id: string; width: number; height: number }` | Placement config for mobile Adbutler banner | - | - | `{'id':'654321','width':'300','height':'100'}` | v1.3.0+ |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Pull Request Description in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the structure for describing a pull request, including sections for the description, proposed changes, breaking changes, and additional information. It uses Markdown formatting to organize the content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## Description and Related Issue(s)

*[Provide a brief description of the changes or enhancements introduced by this pull request and explain motivation behind them. Cite any related issue(s) or bug(s) that it addresses using the [format](https://blog.github.com/2013-05-14-closing-issues-via-pull-requests/) `Fixes #123` or `Resolves #456`.]*

### Proposed Changes
*[Specify the changes or additions made in this pull request. Please mention if any changes were made to the ENV variables]*

### Breaking or Incompatible Changes
*[Describe any breaking or incompatible changes introduced by this pull request. Specify how users might need to modify their code or configurations to accommodate these changes.]*

### Additional Information
*[Include any additional information, context, or screenshots that may be helpful for reviewers.]*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ChakraProvider Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Example of wrapping an application with ChakraProvider and using a Blockscout UI component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/toolkit/package/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { ChakraProvider } from '@chakra-ui/react';
import { Button } from '@blockscout/ui-toolkit';
import theme from './theme';

function App() {
  return (
    <ChakraProvider theme={theme}>
      <Button>Click me</Button>
    </ChakraProvider>
  );
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecated Environment Variables Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table documenting deprecated environment variables with their types, descriptions, requirements, default values, example values, version introduction, deprecation version, and comments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/DEPRECATED_ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type | Description | Compulsoriness | Default value | Example value | Introduced in version | Deprecated in version | Comment |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_FAVICON_GENERATOR_API_KEY | `string` | RealFaviconGenerator [API key](https://realfavicongenerator.net/api/) | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.11.0 | v1.16.0 | Replaced FAVICON_GENERATOR_API_KEY |
| FAVICON_GENERATOR_API_KEY | `string` | RealFaviconGenerator [API key](https://realfavicongenerator.net/api/) | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.16.0+ | v1.37.0 | We don't use RealFaviconGenerator anymore |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_OPTIMISTIC_L2_NETWORK | `boolean` | Set to true for optimistic L2 solutions | Required | - | `true` | v1.17.0 | v1.24.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLUP_TYPE |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_IS_ZKEVM_L2_NETWORK | `boolean` | Set to true for zkevm L2 solutions  | Required | - | `true` | v1.17.0 | v1.24.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLUP_TYPE |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_OPTIMISTIC_L2_WITHDRAWAL_URL | `string` | URL for optimistic L2 -> L1 withdrawals | Required | - | `https://app.optimism.io/bridge/withdraw` | v1.17.0 | v1.24.0 | Renamed to NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLUP_L2_WITHDRAWAL_URL |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_L1_BASE_URL | `string` | Blockscout base URL for L1 network | Required | - | 'http://eth-goerli.blockscout.com' | - | v1.24.0 | Renamed to NEXT_PUBLIC_ROLLUP_L1_BASE_URL |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_HOMEPAGE_SHOW_GAS_TRACKER | `boolean` | Set to false if network doesn't have gas tracker | - | `true` | `false` | - | v1.25.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_GAS_TRACKER_ENABLED |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_GOVERNANCE_TOKEN_SYMBOL | `string` | Network governance token symbol | - | - | `GNO` | v1.12.0 | v1.29.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_NETWORK_SECONDARY_COIN_SYMBOL |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_SWAP_BUTTON_URL | `string` | Application ID in the marketplace or website URL | - | - | `uniswap` | v1.24.0 | v1.31.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_DEFI_DROPDOWN_ITEMS |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_HOMEPAGE_SHOW_AVG_BLOCK_TIME | `boolean` | Set to false if average block time is useless for the network | - | `true` | `false` | v1.0.x+ | v1.35.0 | Replaced by NEXT_PUBLIC_HOMEPAGE_STATS |
```

TITLE: Basic Theme Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Basic theme setup importing and exporting the default Blockscout theme.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/toolkit/package/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
// Basic setup
import { theme } from '@blockscout/ui-toolkit';
export default theme;
```

TITLE: Building SVG Icon Sprite (Bash)

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn svg:build-sprite
```

TITLE: Starting Docker Container with Preset Configuration (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the application from a previously built local Docker image using a predefined configuration preset.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn start:docker:preset <config_preset_name>
```

LANGUAGE: bash

TITLE: Configuring Sentry Error Monitoring in Blockscout Frontend (Deprecated)
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for Sentry error monitoring integration. Note that this feature is deprecated and will be removed in future releases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockscout/frontend/blob/main/docs/ENVS.md#2025-04-22_snippet_48

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable | Type| Description | Compulsoriness  | Default value | Example value | Version |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN | `string` | Client key for your Sentry.io app | Required | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.0.x+ |
| SENTRY_CSP_REPORT_URI | `string` | URL for sending CSP-reports to your Sentry.io app | - | - | `<your-secret>` | v1.0.x+ |
| NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_ENABLE_TRACING | `boolean` | Enables tracing and performance monitoring in Sentry.io | - | `false` | `true` | v1.17.0+ |
```
